summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, providing information about Minor Victim-4 as referenced in a superseding indictment (S2 20 Cr. 330). The letter lists Bates ranges of discovery materials relevant to this victim and is designated as confidential under a protective order.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced (20 Cr. 330). The superseding indictment (S2 Indictment) contains new allegations.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the letter to defense counsel.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case, governing the handling of confidential materials.

events.title: Government Provides Information on Minor Victim-4
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends a letter to defense counsel identifying discovery materials related to Minor Victim-4, as referenced in a superseding indictment.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A superseding indictment (S2 Indictment) in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell contains new allegations involving an individual identified as Minor Victim-4.
The U.S. Attorney's Office provided defense counsel with a list of Bates ranges of discovery materials already produced that relate to Minor Victim-4.
The letter and the listed materials are governed by a confidential protective order dated July 31, 2020.
The letter is itself designated as 'confidential' because it includes information from records designated as confidential under the protective order.
The list of Bates ranges is not exhaustive and does not include every portion of discovery relevant to Minor Victim-4.
